title: Bug 4964: Automatic Code Assist needs to be smarter
description: Since DISPOSED is first in the list and is selected, I ended up with 'button.DISPOSED' which isn't even close to what I want, and I have to delete it all and start again, paying more attention this time. Code assist should notice that I have typed a '(' and that this matches 'dispose()' far better than 'DISPOSED'. Either that, or it needs to be case sensitive when it is automatically inserting stuff.
OB: While writing SWT code in Build 204, I type the following: button.dispose. At this point, I do not realize that the code assist list is open because I am not looking. There are 2 items in the list now: DISPOSED, intWidget, dispose(), and voidWidget. I then type '(' because the line I was typing was supposed to be: button.dispose(); But as soon as I type the '(', the automatic code assist seems to insert whatever is selected.
EB: The automatic code assist should recognize that after typing 'button.dispose', adding a '(' indicates that I am about to type 'button.dispose()', and should suggest that option instead of 'button.DISPOSED' or any other options. It should also be case sensitive when automatically inserting code suggestions.
SR:
1. Open the IDE and start writing SWT code.
2. Type 'button.dispose'.
3. Do not look at the code assist list.
4. After typing 'button.dispose', type '('.
5. Observe that the code assist inserts a suggestion based on the previous selection instead of the expected 'dispose()' method.
6. Verify that the code assist does not provide case-sensitive suggestions.
